title.rendered: Kennar Tawnee Chasny’s “Ting! The Silent Warning” Explores the Bonds That Define Communities

content.rendered:
“Ting! The Silent Warning” is a thought-provoking exploration of the profound concept of community, underscored by themes of friendship, survival, and justice.

COOKSTOWN, NEW JERSEY, UNITED STATES, April 19, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ — In a resounding testament to the literary talent of author Kennar Tawnee Chasny, debut novel, “Ting! The Silent Warning,” has garnered a stellar review that celebrates its unique blend of light suspense and fantasy. The review, published by Hollywood Book Reviews, praises Chasny’s ability to weave an enchanting tale that captivates readers from beginning to end.

Set against the breathtaking backdrop of a small mountain community, “Ting! The Silent Warning” follows the lives of two remarkable women, Lilly and Joanne. Lilly, a strong-willed artist, seeks solace and independence in her grandparents’ cabin, breaking free from the clutches of her greedy parents. Joanne, a widower yearning for peace and quiet, escapes the bustling city in search of tranquility within the same mountain community. Little do they know that their lives are about to intertwine in ways they could never have imagined.

“Ting! The Silent Warning” is unequivocally the ideal choice for readers in search of their next feel-good story. With its masterful blend of suspense, fantasy, and heartwarming romance, Chasny’s debut novel promises to leave readers with a sense of satisfaction and a heart full of joy.

To know more about Kennar Tawnee Chasny and the works, readers may visit the author’s website at www./kennarchasny.com.

To get the latest update on authors, book events, publishing and marketing opportunities, like and follow Writers’ Branding on Facebook.

About Writers’ Branding

Writers’ Branding is a full-service self-publishing company that provides aspiring authors exclusive access to publicity and a pool of book evaluators and marketing creatives and bridges them to literary agencies and traditional publishing houses.

Please visit www.writersbranding.com for more information.

Lyn Goot
